intro: Stigmaphyllon cuzcanum, commonly known as the Cuzcanum stigmaphyllon, is a member of the Malvaceae family, native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often divided into several lobes. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive yellow or white coloration. Stigmaphyllon cuzcanum is also noted for its fibrous bark, which has been used in traditional medicine.
